rationale: 'shot up' is a vivid verb describing a background condition (prices), ignored for Q1.
statement_text: By the end of October, US retail prices for female turkeys had shot up 28 per cent year on year, according to US Department of Agriculture data.

rationale: The high-potency verb 'shot up' describes the price increase (direct impact).
statement_text: By the end of October, US retail prices for female turkeys had shot up 28 per cent year on year, according to US Department of Agriculture data.
